Freelance.portfolioInfo: This portfolio was coded in React, TailwindCSS, and CSS by myself.

intro.internship: fixed-term contract from September 2024 to the end of February 2025

skills.webMobileDevelopment: My skills in web/mobile development include

Internship.lookingFor: If you are looking for a reliable and competent web/mobile developer for your projects, feel free to contact me. I am flexible with technical stacks and working arrangements, and I will be happy to discuss with you to find the most suitable solution for your needs.
Internship.portfolioInfo: This portfolio was coded in React, TailwindCSS, and CSS by myself.

currentActivities: Student at UCLA (University of California, Los Angeles)

rakuten.name: Rakuten
description: Development in TypeScript, server-side rendering with NextJS, data fetching via GraphQL.
Adding new features to the website, from UX design to deployment.
Complete (End2End) testing with Cypress, testing React components.
Collaboration on Pull Requests and code reviews, working in a multilingual team.
Migration from JS to TypeScript, in-depth CSS skills, CSS modules, MUI Style Overrides, and CSS in JS.
Advanced use of project management tools like Jira and Notion for complexity estimation.
Experience with multiple Git repositories and dependency management on self-hosted repositories.

ublo.name: Ublo
description: Ublo aims to simplify rental management through an intuitive and efficient property management software.
I was responsible for developing an entry and exit inventory form to be performed on a tablet.
And then, working on the Ublo website for clients.

proMeetup.name: Pro-meetup
description: Creation of a web platform that connects building professionals with individuals.
The site includes an administrator approval process for professional profiles, allowing them to offer their services.
A search bar is integrated to simplify the discovery of professionals suitable for specific needs of individuals.
The main objective was to simplify the search and encourage collaborations in the building industry.

nuvoleviaggi.name: Nuvoleviaggi
description: Creation of a web platform for managing orders and invoices.

The platform includes a dashboard, a list of orders, bank statements, a list of services, a list of refund forms, a page for creating an order, a page for creating a bank account, a page for creating a claim, and the ability to export data in Excel format.
Authentication is required to use the platform.

fratelliB.name: Fratelli.B
description: Website to promote the pizzeria, introduce the business online, view current events, contact the pizzeria, and make advance payments for orders using Paypal.
The administrator has a dashboard to manage orders and products.

evogue.name: EVOGUE
description: As a teacher, I was responsible for preparing, organizing, and delivering programming courses, as well as correcting exercises and assignments for students.
The students had diverse profiles, ranging from beginners learning programming concepts to more advanced students at the Bachelor's and Master's level.
I had to adapt my teaching to their level and needs.

ionis.name: IONIS School of Technology and Management
description: I was responsible for supporting students, facilitating educational activities through mentoring, and participating in school life.
This involved assisting students in their studies and helping them find solutions to problems they encountered.
I also conducted project follow-ups, project presentations, and supervised students during coding bootcamps.
I primarily worked with students in the 1st and 2nd year of the Web@cadémie program, as well as the Coding Club program.

webAcademie.name: Web@cademie
description: Teacher / Assistant during a PHP bootcamp for the Web@cademie program.
For 3 weeks, I guided future developers in learning programming, starting with the PHP language, while managing my own projects simultaneously.

rType.name: R-Type
description: R-Type is a horizontal scrolling shooter arcade video game developed and published by Irem in 1987, and the first game in the R-Type series.
The player controls a spacecraft, the R-9 'Arrowhead', in its efforts to destroy the Bydo, a powerful alien race determined to annihilate all of humanity.
The game is networked, with a client and a server.
The server must be multithreaded to be able to handle multiple clients simultaneously and minimize lag.
This project must be carried out under real development conditions, using version control, testing, documentation, packaging tools, etc.

zappy.name: Zappy
description: The goal of this project is to create a multiplayer game.
Multiple teams compete on a tile-based map containing resources.
The winning team is the one with 6 players who have reached the maximum elevation.
The players are controlled by artificial intelligence.

indieStudio.name: Indie Studio
description: The objective of this project is to develop a cross-platform 3D video game using real-world tools.
The game in question is a 3D Bomberman.

arcade.name: Arcade
description: The objective of this project was to create a game platform, with a single core that can dynamically load multiple different graphics libraries, and with at least two games.
The chosen graphics libraries were SFML, Ncurses, and SDL2.
The chosen games were Nibbler and Pacman.
The player can choose their nickname, select their game, dynamically switch between graphics libraries, and has a score recorded in a database.

myRpg.name: my_rpg
description: As the name suggests, the goal of this project was to create a Role Playing Game (RPG), with a story, quests, levels, battles, dungeons, inventory, skill levels, and many other features that characterize an RPG.

myDefender.name: my_defender
description: A mini League Of Legends, anyone?
The goal of this project was to create a Tower Defense game, with a base to defend and enemies that appear and attack the base.
The player's objective is to defend their base by placing towers that can destroy enemies. Each tower has specific characteristics (damage, range, impact on enemy attributes, etc.).
To place a tower, the player needs to have a certain amount of money, and towers can also be upgraded.
All graphics and sounds are taken from the official League Of Legends game.

myRunner.name: my_runner
description: You're probably familiar with the T-Rex Game, right? The one that Google offers when you don't have an internet connection.
I recreated it with different graphics, but the goal remains the same - it's a runner game.
The objective is to make your character jump in a huge scrolling map, avoiding obstacles and enemies.
At the end of the map, there is a finish line, which means you have won the game!
At that moment, your score is saved, and you can start a new game from your previous score. This way, you can always try to achieve the highest score!

myHunter.name: my_hunter
description: Piou Piou! + Among us = ?
You got it! My my_hunter.
Enemies come from the right and left, and in the middle of the map, there is a base that the enemies must not cross, or else you lose health points.
To prevent this, you are equipped with a weapon that allows you to kill the enemies before they reach the base!

mySokoban.name: my_sokoban
description: The goal of this project was to create a Sokoban-type game, where there is a character who must push boxes onto specific locations.
The character cannot push multiple boxes at once, cannot push a box onto another box, and cannot push a box onto a wall.
The character can move in four directions, restart the game, quit the game, return to the main menu, and more.

matchstick.name: matchstick
description: The goal of this project was to create a Nim-type game, where there are a number of matches, a player, and a computer.
The player and the computer take turns removing matches, with the goal of removing the last match.
The player can remove 1, 2, or 3 matches each turn, and the computer will remove the number of matches that allows it to win.

epiSolidaire.name: EpiSolidaire
description: Website to promote the association, introduce it online, receive donations, view upcoming and past events, contact us, access member area, and consequently access the dashboard.

area.name: AREA
description: AREA is a platform for managing automated tasks. AREA stands for Action REAction.
Like IFTTT or Zapier, AREA allows creating automated tasks.
AREA has a server, a web client, and a mobile client.
Users can log in using our authentication system, or they can also log in using their Google, Discord, Microsoft, or Facebook accounts through OAuth2.
Once logged in, users can create automated tasks by selecting an action and a reaction from a list of services.
For example, they can create a task that makes their phone ring when they receive an email on their Gmail account containing a specific keyword.
Once an AREA is created, it is saved in the database and is available in the user's list of active AREAs.
Users can also delete an AREA.
AREA is primarily server-focused, which means that everything available on the web client is also available on the mobile client.
The application is deployed using Docker.

proMeetup.name: Pro-meetup
description: Creation of a web platform that connects building professionals with individuals.
The site includes an administrator approval process for professional profiles, allowing them to offer their services.
A search bar is integrated to simplify the discovery of professionals that match the specific needs of individuals.
The main goal was to simplify the search and encourage collaborations in the building industry.

myAllocine.name: MyAllociné
description: Design and implementation of an MVP for a fictional startup 'NeoMovie', aspiring to compete with AlloCiné.

Development of a homepage, a login interface with session storage, user-specific movie preferences customization, advanced search with filters by year, genre, and language, as well as playlist creation and viewing history management features.
The goal was to provide users with an immersive and personalized movie experience.

rTypeWebsite.name: R-Type Website
description: After coding the R-Type game, I decided to create a website to promote it, download it, and play online.

The website contains a Home section, a Media section where you can see videos and images of the game, a Games section where you can find other games that I have coded, an About section where you can learn more about the game and the development team, and finally a Download section where you can download the game and see the latest updates.

owl.name: OWL
description: OWL (Other Way to Look) is a mobile application that helps prevent drowsiness while driving.
The application consists of a mobile client and a server.
The mobile application is connected to a smartwatch that mainly detects the driver's heart rate, oxygen intake, and sleep duration.
Based on this information, an algorithm is applied to determine if the driver is tired or not.
If the driver is tired, the mobile application takes action to alert them and suggests taking a break.
An action can be characterized by a vibration of the smartwatch, phone, a message on the phone, a call, etc...
The driver can then get a destination to go to the nearest point of interest (restaurant, hotel, etc...) if needed.

erp.name: ERP
description: Creation of a web platform for managing an order and invoice manager.

The platform includes a dashboard, a list of orders, bank statements, a list of services, a list of refund forms, a page for creating an order, a page for creating a bank account, a page for creating a claim, and the ability to export data in Excel format.
To use the platform, authentication is required.

portfolio.name: Portfolio
description: My experience, my skills, my personality; all of this cannot be summarized in a CV, that's why I created this portfolio.
You can find my projects, my skills, my experiences, my association, contact me, and much more!

popeye.name: Popeye
description: Popeye is a project that involves containerizing a web application.
For this, we had to use Docker, a tool that allows creating containers, i.e., virtual environments.
The application consisted of a Flask poll, a Redis queue, a Java worker, a PostgreSQL database, and a NodeJS result.
So we had to containerize our web application and be able to deploy it locally.

fratelliPizza.name: Fratelli Pizza
description: Website to promote the pizzeria, introduce it online, view current events, contact the pizzeria, and prepay an order using Paypal.
The administrator has a dashboard to manage orders and products.

42sh.name: 42sh
description: Create a Unix Shell that is based on the TCSH reference model.

my_malloc.name: my_malloc
description: Recode the malloc, realloc, calloc, reallocarray, and free functions.

my_web.name: my_web
description: Create a dual boot between Debian and Arch Linux on a virtual machine without using a graphical interface to assemble the partitions.

my_printf.name: my_printf
description: Recode the printf function.

my_ls.name: my_ls
description: Recode the ls command.

my_cat.name: my_cat
description: Recode the cat command.

my_teams.name: my_teams
description: Recode teams

my_db.name: my_db
description: Create a database with a single table implemented as a linked list.
The table consists of the following fields:
id (= Unique identifier per column)
firstname (= First name)
lastname (= Last name)
pseudonyme (= Pseudonym)
birthday (= Date of birth)
city (= City)
phone (= Phone number)
email (= Email)
password (= Password)
registeredAt (= Registration date)

BSQ.name: BSQ
description: Find the largest square in a grid of characters.
The grid consists of '.' characters and 'o' characters.
The program should display the grid with the first largest square filled with 'x'.

MiniLibC.name: MiniLibC
description: Recode the functions of the standard C library in x86_64 assembly.
The functions were:
• strlen
• strchr
• strrchr
• memset
• memcpy
• strcmp
• memmove
• strncmp
• strcasecmp
• strstr
• strpbrk
• strcspn

bdsh.name: bdsh
description: Write a shell script that allows managing a database in a json file.
You must create tables, insert-update-delete data, execute queries, ...
The command line should be able to create a database, a table, insert data, delete data, select data, ...
The jq command-line tool was prohibited.

cashRegister.name: Cash register
description: Code a cash register that can record items, store them in a database, generate receipts, create new cashiers who are also stored in a database, etc...
